translated: The Monastic Code of the Elders
The Great Analysis🔽The chapter on training rules
1. The training rule on shaking the hand

original: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
analyzed: tena samayena buddhaḥ bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme
translated: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery

original: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū hatthaniddhunakaṁ bhuñjanti …pe….
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyāḥ bhikkhū hattha niddhunakam bhuñjanti pe
translated: the monks from the group of six were eating while shaking their hands. …

analyzed: na hattha niddhunakam bhuñjissāmi iti sikkhā karaṇīyā ati
translated: “‘I will not eat while shaking my hand,’ this is how you should train.”
One should not eat while shaking one’s hand.

original: Yo anādariyaṁ paṭicca hatthaniddhunakaṁ bhuñjati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
analyzed: yaḥ anādariyam paṭicca hattha niddhunakam bhuñjati āpatti dukkaṭassa
translated: If a monk, out of disrespect, eats while shaking his hand, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

analyzed: anāpatti  a san cit ca  assatiyā
translated: There is no offense🔽if it is unintentional;
if he is not thinking;🔽if he does not know;
if he shakes his hand while discarding scraps;
if he is the first offender.🔽The seventh training rule is finished.
